name: sfchronicle
text: We need an attitude adjustment, says Dr. David Spiegel, medical director of the Stanford Center on Stress and Health — and universal sick leave. https://t.co/n2C8hy2LWi

name: sfchronicle
text: Across the Bay Area, residents are envisioning how a region at its breaking point can use this tumultuous moment to rebuild a more equitable society. https://t.co/8T8p8nsRlY

name: sfchronicle
text:
The SF Giants and Oakland A’s hope to welcome fans back to their ballparks in 2021, if health officials permit. But developing a plan is difficult when nobody can predict how many spectators will be allowed in or how many will feel comfortable returning.
https://t.co/w9yak7cQdz

name: sfchronicle
text:
A low-income family does not have to include state payments to care for a mentally ill child as part of its income for Section 8 housing eligibility, the state Supreme Court ruled Monday.
https://t.co/Zau4qtYhjH

name: sfchronicle
text: “As we analyze how our workplace will change in a post-COVID world, we are specifically rethinking where future employees could be based,” said Todd Morgenfeld, Pinterest’s chief financial officer, in a statement.  https://t.co/X3xk6rPJEe

name: sfchronicle
text: What happened to the A’s and the 49ers from Sunday to Monday morning proves everyone must remain vigilant about the coronavirus, says @AnnKillion:  https://t.co/MX9juKYBXQ

name: sfchronicle
text: “We need to rethink how scheduled children are,” Leyla Bologlu, a pediatric neuropsychologist in San Francisco says. “How many adults work more than 8 or 10 hours? We ask our children to work those hours.” https://t.co/FWQTRZUesO

name: sfchronicle
text:
For diehard Giants fan, Emily Doskow, a coronavirus vaccine is a must before returning to Oracle Park. Others would attend a game right now. What will it take for fans to feel safe in the new normal?
https://t.co/76EATWk7gU
